WRITING.TEXT: Meine Mutter und ich haben heute angefangen Masken zu n #228;hen und wollen diese f #252;r einen freiwilligen Betrag verkaufen und den Erl #246;s dann spenden, zum Beispiel einer Hundepension, die aktuell kostenlos Hunde aufnimmt f #252;r Leute, die sich auf Grund von Infektion usw. nicht um sie k #252;mmern k #246;nnen. Die Masken sind aus 100% Baumwolle, also mit 60 #176; waschbar und wiederverwendbar und besitzen ein Fach, in welches ein Filter reingegeben werden kann. Wir brauchen gemeinsam aktell etwa 20 bis 15 Minuten pro Maske und ich wollte euch fragen, was ihr bereit w #228;r f #252;r so eine Maske zu zahlen, da wir uns nicht sicher sind, was wir unseren Freunden und Bekannten als "Richtwert" sagen sollen. Wir haben verschiedene Stoffe mit Mustern zuhause, ich kann euch auch per Anfrage Bilder schicken (Allerdings erst morgen, da die ersten gerade in der W #228;sche sind, aktuell hab ich nur eines von meiner Maske im Pandadesign). TL;DR: Wir machen 100% Baumwollmasken mit Filterfach. Wieviel w #228;rt ihr daf #252;r bereit zu zahlen, wenn der Erl #246;s gespendet wird?

I dont know if you have any prior experience with selfharm or other addictions, but its really hard to stop once you start so thats a big achivement. No matter if its the first step or youve been going for a while its really hard and sometimes you have nobody to talk to and thats why people share their improvements here.

Some people, me including, also do it to release stress too. It was a bad combination for me with my already huge self hatred. Its just like letting air out of a floaty toy you have in a pool. People grow desperate and I also think that getting neglected makes those feelings even stronger. If youre at a point you dont know what to do and find out about self harm and you hear that it makes you better and you think you have no options left you just do it because you have nothing left to lose. Thats at least how it was for me. Im not saying self harm is good or anything but some people have nothing else they can grasp on and thats what gets them started. Maybe you even know a couple of people who do it. People tend to find ways to hide it and not always use their arm as you may know. I used my thigh since Ive always hated shorts and never wore something that showed my thighs so its really easy to hide. Since Ive started with the intend that I never wanted anyone to know, thats how I dealt with it. Some people dont care if they get seen and I think only a real small amount actually does it for the attention it gets them. I know someone already explained it to you but since you seemed curious I thought Id share my story too. Sorry if its hard to understand. English is not my native language and I also just woke up to my neighbours fighting amd this really released some stress for me instead of something I should and do not want to do.

Im in a similar situation that shes in although without someone showing interest at the moment so Im trying to explain how I would feel about it. I dont know how her relationships where but Ive been told a couple of times that people take care of me and promised that they would stay by my side just to get pushed away when I hit rock bottom. For me Im just scared that it happens again and that I would lose a person whos dear to me and whom I might even love, developing feelings I cant stop and getting hurt in the end because it seems that it always end in a bad way. Its nothing someone, or at least I, can really control and I guess it just takes time. When she says she wants do forget what youve had and put in some distance it might be more for herself so she doesnt develop any more feelings than she already has because she might tend to get overwhelmed by those and then might start a relationship shes not ready for. The only advise I can give you is just stay by her side as a friend and support her and dont push her if youre ready to wait for her. Its not guaranteed that youll get together in the future but I think thats the thing I would want. Someone you can depend on and helps you heal. I know this sounds selfish and frienzoneish. But I guess thats all you can do for now based on my opinion and experience.

I was in a similar situation as your gf once. It was very unlikely for me to get pregnant since women who take the pill for a long time have trouble getting pregnant but I was still worried af. I think its normal for her to freak out but its not ok to take it out on you. Maybe you can sit down and talk about it. About how worried you are too and that its taking a toll on you. Maybe she doesnt realize it. Itll be a hard time until you know for sure and itll stress her out a lot since there might be a lot of pressure on her if she is pregnant as a 16 year old. I was 21 and was still worried what people might think about me if it happened and I dont think I can imagine how stressed out she must be and you too. Things will work out for you guys Im sure of it. Talk about it properly and when everythings over youll have a good laugh (at least I had about my stupid worries).

Multiple gynecologists said to me, that taking the pill for a longer time, especially before youre 21 can impact your ability to get pregnant after not taking the pill for up to 12 months. Dont have any research on that, but I trust my doctors. Its not impossible but theres a chance that youre having touble for I think up to 12 months.

We went to a chinese restaurant when I was 17. I made sure I look pretty so I wore a dress and even heels which I never wear so I cant walk around that much with them. Since he invited me he checked the bus connection back home, since we were still wroking on getting our license back them. My mom drove us to the restaurant, we had some really nice dinner and after some time passed we decided to go home. The restaurant was in the middle of nowhere and the next city was about 3km away and that was where we were headed. Bus stop was outside next to the restaurant so we went there and he checked for the next bus. It was out of order. Now we stood there. It was around 10pm in fall and it was raining just a little bit. I didnt really dress up planing we where out for a long time so I started freezing shortly after. We called our families and relatives but noone answered so we started walking on the road with speedlimit 80 km/h and me with heels I can hardly walk in to the next city in about 3km. The reason why I was really pissed is because he promised everything was planned and he was very proud of it and even braged about how he had planned everything into detail. Too bad he didnt look if the bus was still running at this hour. Somewhere in the middel of our way his uncle called back and said hed pick us up in the next city. What a great first date that was.

Not made but somehow related. When I was about 13 years old I was exploring a lake on a floaty when we were on vacation. There was a storm the day before so there was awesome stuff to find. Or so I thought. I found something big floating in the water and when I came closer I realized what it was. A dead headless baby cow. I could see the spine standing out and there was a dead rat in its neck. I was shocked and tried to get away. In my panick I fell into the water right next to it. About 10 years later I gotta say I love beef once more.

I dont think youre weak at all. Youre still going and that shows me that you still have some will to fight left. I know depression sucks. Im currently in my second relaps too amd Ive been home for a year now. I used to be a trainee, baker and confectioner, and I loved this job. It filled me with joy to make people smile with what I made. But due to the toxic work enviroment and my upbringing I relapsed and I had to quit earlier this year because I had to start working again in order for me to get better once more. Then all this shit started and it made things a lot harder. Since my first episode I dropped almost all of my hobbies and there was almost nothing I enjoyed anymore. But looking back things got better. Almost exactly a year ago I hit rock bottom too, just like you. Back then I lived with my ex and I locked myself in our room, having a mental break down again. I didnt know what to do. He yelled at me and all I had to calm me down were my blades. And I think the decision I made back then saved me. I went to the hospital and stayed there for a while due to my mental health. It sucked to be there and even my boss came once to talk about the situation. After that I wanted to take things into my own hands. Sure, I was depressed and wanted to die but I didnt want to waste aways like the people were doing there. Its been really hard since then but in the meanwhile I managed to move out and Im now living on my own. Sure, depression still wont leave me alone amd my place is sometimes pretty messy. But now I am actually able to do something against it by myself. And knowing this gives me strengh. It might not be that big of an achivement but we have to start small. Also, did you know that depression is just agression against yourself? Its just depression telling you that youre a terrible person. I dont believe you are a bad person and Im sure your bf and your friends would agree with me. People just tend to be overwhelmed with someone being depressed and dont know how to handle it. Some dont want to bring it up because they dont know how or they think its rude. I think if you talk with them about it they will gladly help you through your though times. Youre not alone in this. Im sure you can do this. It might take a while to get back to enjoying your hobbies and stuff like that but that time will come again. Depression just makes you stronger and I also think more empathetic. Please dont give up and if you ever want to rant again or need to talk to someone I gladly listen to you. I know just how hard it is to accept the offer but I really mean it and you wouldnt bother me one bit. Im there if you ever need someone to talk to. Youre not alone in this.

Our neighbour got it. She had surgery before the whole covid thing got to us in europe and stayed there for I think 2 weeks since shes already 80. Then the thing in italy started and shortly after she and all the other patiens from this smaller hospital suddenly got sent home. I think a few days later it hit our area too. 2 and a half weeks later she was sent to the bigger hospital because she had symtoms and the test was positive. Luckly our area only had a few cases so she could be treated but noone knew how she got it since she stayed home all the time and also had no visitors and her groceries where left in front of her door whenever she needed something. Thanks to the treatment she survived but even after she was better we still didnt know where she got it. Until some nurse found out that the hospital she was in before the breakdown had a case which they didnt really tell anyone about it and just sent everybody home instead. Of course people found out later and people where really angry but nothing really happened to that hospital later as far as I know. Im really glad she is now alive and well. If she would have lived somewhere else where covid hit harder she probably wouldnt have made it simply because she was too old for treatment and it would rather be used on younger people. I wish everyone good luck and hope your loved ones get well soon.

WRITING.TITLE: How do I F22 fix my relationship with my mom? Should I even try to fix it?
WRITING.TEXT: Its been bothering me for years now and I just cant figure out a way how to fix our relationship. Or if I should even fix it. Its not that we are having a bad relationship or anything but she did quite some things in the past that hurt me a lot and it seems like I just cant forgive her. Now a little background. My parents were young when they had me. My mom was 20 and my dad was 21. They always say I was planned but not that early which already felt like I wasnt really wanted but thats not bothering me at all. My childhood was great, I felt loved and I didnt feel like anything was missing since I was their princess. 6 and a half years later my brother was born. He is disabled, physically amd mentaly and will never be able to look after himself. My mom knew her life was pretty much over since it was clear for her she had to devote her live to him. My parents still rather young where pretty overwhelmed with that so I stepped back and went from the lively energy ball who loved to make trouble to the quiet good girl that did as she was told. Imo I stepped back out of free will, my therapist says I was forced into it and then neglected but I dont think that way. Timeskip when I was like 8 or 9 years old. I got molested by a friends dad and it took me a couple of years to tell someone. I think I was 13 when I told my mom. I thought shed understand since they were really worried about me when they found out my uncle was a rapist a couple of years back so I was confident that she would comfort and help me. We sat down and I told her. All she said was "What do you want me to do?" in a way that felt like "why the f are you telling me this" and then she continued doing laundry. This still bothers me up until today. When I was 18 or something like that we were talking about the future and we talked about my brother. She said she didnt want him to live somewhere for disabled people called "supervised living" because people who live there get 'regularly' molested. It really struck me that she cared about him being molested but not me. Timeskip to earlier this year. I wanted to talk with her about it again. About how she reacted, why she cared about my brother being molested but not me. Her answer was there must have been a misunderstanding and that she must have gotten it wrong or something like that but it doesnt feel genuine. Ahe tries really hard to please me but it just doesnt feel real and I dont know how to fix it or if I should even fix it. I dont even care anymore about the part where I was molested the only thing that really hurts and wears me out mentally is her not caring. TL;DR: Told mom I was molested, didnt care. Years later worries about younger brother being molested. Talked with her again, said it was all just a misunderstanding but doesnt feel real or genuine. How can I and should I fix this relationship?

Just yesterday some really nice people helped me decide if I should fix my broken relationship with my mom.

Ive been diagnosed with anxiety disorder and depression a couple of years ago. After I not enjoying anything anymore and being scared to go to work I talked to my normal doctor about it. He tried some mild medication first before sending me to a psychiatrist. He then diagnosed me and I visited him frequently until I got better last winter. Now I only visit him when I feel like I need to but Im still going to therapy (those are seperate here). Its really easy, just tell them how you feel and try to describe it as good as you can. I know it takes a lot to talk about it first but I think it really helps a lot. Hope things are getting better for you!

I got diagnosed a couple of years ago. Things are getting better, but Im still suffering from it. My flat is a mess and I just cant manage to keep it clean. I have times where I dont enjoy anything and sometimes I stay in my bed for days. But those are getting less. I havent been able to work for over a year now but I finally managed to get some lessons thatll help me get a job later on. Im starting tomorrow and I know it will be hard. But looking back, Ive managed worse. I dont really have any close family that keeps me from ending it all. I just have this one best friend I dont want to leave behind and Im sure things will work eventually and there will be a time Ill get to be happy (again?). When I was younger I wanted to end it all a lot of times but I always told myself that I dont deserve to just go. I deserve the suffering. I know its not healthy to think this way but those thoughts kept me alive until I found my best friend so Im glad I had them. Now I wanna get stronger for her and keep going, knowing we will have more and more fun times where we enjoy ourselves and I cant wait to get there.

Im very sorry for your loss. I remember when my greatgrandma and cousin died when I was in primary school. I couldnt cope with it until I think I was 20. It might not be the same as yours but I felt really sad and guilty since my parents went to visit my granny the evening before she passed but I wanted to stay home play games on my new DS. The next day she was found dead. Almost the same with my cousin. She was in hospital due to something rather minor and I had a long school day and just wanted to play some games and relax planning on visiting her tomorrow. She died the same night. I was 15 at that time. What helped me was my therapist. Im in therapy due to depression and one day it came up and after a lot of talking I felt better. I know it cant be compared but maybe talking about it will help. I recommend a therapist if just talking to a friend or something wont help if its something that sits deeper. Maybe theres also some regret that you have amd thats the reason why you cant let go. It helped me but again Im not sure if you can compare this since the bond to a sibling is deeper than the relationship I had to them. I hope youre feeling better soon.

I wouldnt recommend that. Only maybe as last resort. I struggled with selfharm when I was in my last relationship and if my partner were to call the cops on me Id have a hard time facing him again out of embarrassment and fear they think Im weird

Asure him youre there for him. It takes a lot to talk to your loved one about it. For me it was because I was embarrassed and I feared them leaving be because I was weird. If possible dont try to stare at the marks he has as it can make one feel even worse and thus continuing the circle. I would recommend talking to him about his mental health and seeing a doctor if you think hes up for it. Some people dont take that too well and since I believe you know your husband pretty good I think you know if you can bring it up or if hes too uncomfortable to talk to a professional because people might look down on him or something. I didnt like talking about it with my partner as they seemed to pitty me making things harder on me. Sadly I dont have a solution for your problem since I couldnt even solve it myself when I was in his position. Itll probably take quite some time but I think itll help if you support him in other ways and again make sure he knows youre there for him and that he can trust you with anything. I rather talked to my therapist about it but then again I dont know if thats an option for your husband. Maybe get some bandaids and stuff to treat the wounds for him and leaving then where you know he will find them if he needs them. It shows that you care about him although he does that. At least thats what I wished for. I hope things get better for the two of you and that you can find a proper way to communicate about his problems someday. I wish you the best.
Sounds like a troll to me. If its real I feel bad for your wife. She deserves way better than such an abusive husband. I also feel really bad for the kids.

I went there because if I didnt I knew I kill myself. There were some really kind nurses and it really felt like they want to help you but the one that was looking after me didnt really care. We talked about different therapies and I said Im really uncomfotable with big groups and I hate doing exercise in front of other people because I feel judged and stuff like that. He probably wasnt listening or didnt care and said hed sign me up for something like dancing therapy and I couldnt even say anything. Im glad I could talk about it do a doctor that I cant do that and that was no problem and so I got into something like a small yoga group, music, crafting and some light sports therapies. Overall I think it can really help but for me it just didnt feel right. Since I went there by myself I could leave when I wanted about 2.5 weeks after I got there. The medication sure helped a lot when I was there but when I got home they switched the dosis which lead to huge sleeping problems and me needing sleeping pills. A few months later I dropped the medication since I felt like a zombie and got something more natural which worked better for me. I dont know how it works in other countries but here in austria I think its going pretty well and if you need help and you ask for it you will get it. At least thats my experience.

When I was in primary school my best friends dad slipped his hand up my long pants and touched me. I couldnt say anything and just pretended to move in my sleep which made him stop. After what feld forever I still couldnt sleepcagain and woke my friend up, telling her I had a stomach ache. We slept in her parents bed and her dad then usually slept in hers and since her mother worked that night her dad came and came next to me, slipped his hand again in my pants and asked me if it hurts there. I instantly said no and after a few seconds that felt like forever again he removed it. He then decided to sleep between us and I just couldnt sleep anymore. It was only 4am at that time. They fell asleep again and nothing more happened and as soon as it was 6am I just left there going home in the snow and waited in front of our frontdoor until someone at home was awake. Today Im not really affected by it anymore I just panic if someone touches my feet since I remember but that can be avoided. What still bothers me though is that my mom didnt care when I told her a couple of years later. I talked about it with her earlier this year again and she said it was a missunderstanding and that shes sorry but I just cant get myself to believe her and it really ruined my relationship with her but the fact that I was harassed doesnt bother me anymore.

I already quit social media and whatsapp twice before. The reason was my depression. I felt really pressured by being available at all times and people knowing when Im online and then eventually pressure me into answering when Im not really ready to do that. Part of it also came from my bosses since they just used to text me whenever they needed someone. I think they always asked me because they knew I couldnt say no. I got rid of every thing and was only available per SMS and phone call. I did that for a couple of months until I felt better but even now I try to avoid opening it and dont answer everyone the moment I get their message so they get used to it I guess. I dont really know how to describe it. Sure, some are really useful if I want to share things with my friends but I often with for the old days to come back where you didnt have to be available all the time and people couldnt check on your activities. Its a curse and a blessing but imo its more of a curse. Ive been using whatsapp again for almost a year again and social media since the beginning of the year. Well, I have social media installed but only check it a few times a month.

I often hear that your rank has nothing to do with your normal MMR. I dont know if its true but I get the feeling it is. When I play normals with my friend who is silver and Im always unranked until the season ends and then hurry my ass up to gold for the skin we often have diamond players in our game. Yes it feels unfair but thats just how league of legends works. I have a friend that started playing around a year ago and he had the same problem although when we played with him we used low level accounts so the match up wouldnt be as unfair for him. I think as soon as youre almost lvl 30 riot doesnt give a shit about levels and just matches you with whoever is 30+. I already had people in my game whose level was 5 times as high as mine on my main account. Sure it can tilt you but in the end its just a normal. I get that it sucks to be stomped pretty hard and I hate it too but stuff like that just happens. I try to think of it as a game where I can try out new stuff or just have fun with a friend. For example rn we are leveling new accounts and shes not that good at csing so we give each other cs goals like 80 at 10min and if you cant do it you get a penalty. Also using different unusual builds to get better at it under different conditions. Sure we might lose the game because we are so focused on it but we also learn from it and again its just a normal game where you dont lose anything. Sorry for the wall of text. Im sorry for what youve been through. I might not be able to help you with my personal experience since Im still young but I know how it worked with my parents. They got togetherwhen my mom was 16 and my dad was 17. They married around 19ish and had me with 20/21. Soon after they got a divorce but were still friends. Things just didnt work out at that time. Not too long after that they came together again and married again in 2003 and still are today. Today they are 43 and 44 and they seem happy but from what I can tell you is that over the years I lived with them my father didnt change. When we argued he never saw his wrong doings and stuff like that which bothered me but not my mom. She could accept him how he was and said thats just how he is. I moved out a year ago and to be honest I want to think people can change if they really want but from my experience I have to say it takes a LOT of time. He started showing signs that hes starting to change now but thats only after all those years. It took him over 20 years to finally start. I started to do shooting as a sport when I was 14 or so. I was the worst but for the first time I didnt care because I was really enjoying it. I joined a club for that since I couldnt do it at home and the people were all really nice and I had lots of fun. My dad then said I have to participate in competitions which I hated since I went there and only got like half the points the other people my age got since everyone was doing it since they were little. I didnt want to do it anymore since it ruined the fun for me to only go somewhere and lose by a lot. I did improve but I would never get as good as the ones who startet almost 10 years ahead of me so I quit since my dad didnt want me to be part of the club anymore if I dont do the competitions. Im still sad about it since I had my own gun and everything and I really enjoyed it just to have it ruined by him. I would love to start again but I dont have the money to buy a new one since we sold my old one and Im too old now to borrow one from the club. A couple of years after that I also got depression and stopped drawing which I also really like but I just cant get myself to do it anymore.

If you can talk to your doctor about it. I felt pretty similar and when I first talked to my mom about it she just brushed it off and said sometimes thats how it is. Months later I talked about it again and said I want to talk to my doctor about it and I got diagnosed with depression. Im not saying you have depression but it showed in a similar way for me and thats why I think you should bring it up to a doctor. I got to try some pretty weak medication before being sent to a psychiatrist because sometimes thats enough for people. I know it can take quite a lot to talk about it and you might be ashamed or feel bad but theres no need to. Depression is something most people go through at some point in their life be it diagnosed or undiagnosed. But if its affecting your life too much you should get it looked at and see if it might be the case just to make your life a little bit easier. Its nothing to be ashamed of and its completly normal. It only could get dangerous if you do nothing about it and let it take control of your life.

This reminds me of my time back in high school. I wasnt really popular but I got along with everyone and had a couple of what I would consider close friends and a boyfriend. They all left me when I was 18 and really sick and I was asking myself the same question. After a few years of feeling horrible because I must be a bad person if everyone leaves me I started therapie and it really helped me. Im not only seeing the fault in myself anymore and Ive come to terms with it. By now I dont have that many friends as I had back then but the ones I have are really close and I know they wont leave me. I think you just havent found the right people yet. To me you dont seem like a bad person because you dont blame them, you look at yourself and whats wrong which can be a good thing if its not always. You cant please everyone and it took me a long time to find that out myself and also live like that. Sure, its sad and frustrating to be alone but it will get better. I know it. Give it some time, maybe focus on doing things you like for now and maybe you get to know new potential friends while doing so. I hope things go well for you!

I think there are tons of videos on youtube but youll learn most by playing with better players. Farming is important since it means more gold which results in more items and more damage. Lane trading and knowing what the enemy champion does also helps a lot. It might not be everyones piece of cake but I recommend playing Aram to get to know champions since you get to play a huge variety of champions and also play against them as in normals you usually stick to the same pattern of champs you pick and the other people usually play whats good at the moment so you tend so see more or less the same champions over and over again. Also vision is key. Knowing where the enemy is beforehand is really helpful and a lot of people dont care about it since they think its the supports job. Get vision wards if you have some leftover gold and have some space. Maybe you have some friends who play with you and show you some good spots to ward or something like that. If you dont have anyone to play with you can join me and my friends sometimes if you want. Also if youre not tiltprove and teammates easily tilt you use mute all. It helps a lot and people hardly say anything useful in chat anyway.

I guess you could say I was bullied by my dad. He never really meant it and to be honest the first couple of years it didnt get to me and I would just talk back which was also no problem for him. When I got 11 I started to take things seriously. What if he really meant it? Am I really so dumb and stuff like that? I started talking about it when I was 13 I think after I got my period and he would shittalk me about that. He said its fine and he would stop but a couple of days later things were back how they were before. This went on until I was 16 were I just gave up talking to him. I got tired of building up the courage talking to him about it just to be let down a couple of days later. When I was a child I had tons of selfesteem and wouldnt let things get to me easily but after years of hard work done by my dad it got destroyed eventually and since then Im really selfcautious and I also began hating myself. Im 22 now and moved out by now and I have to say things got better with him since Im not living with them anymore. But the damage is already done. When I was 18 my selfhatred was that huge that I felt like I need to punish myself for everything so I started selfharm. Now Im also depressed which my therapist things comes from the relationship with my father along with other stuff that was going on back then. Im still struggling and have no feelings of love or the like for myself left. But Im working on it and I hope one day I can get my selfesteem back and things will be alright again.

WRITING.TITLE: Smoking and sh were my way of handling anxiety but I want find something more healthy now.
WRITING.TEXT: So Im struggling from depression and anxiety disorder for quite a while now and recently Ive been feeling good. About a year ago I picked up smoking to handle my anxiety and it worked quite well since I hardly selfharmed since then. Now I wanted to stop smoking which is no problem per s #233; but my neighbours are a couple that separated about 2 months ago but are now together again. They fight a lot which triggered my anxiety since I had a toxic relationship before which sounded pretty much like their fights do. I go out everytime I hear them but I just get so shaken that I need SOMETHING, be it a cig or selfharm. I dont need to smoke any other time of the day, only when I get triggered by them. Has anyone some advice or gone through something similar? Anything would be a huge help.

I think I can relate to how youre feeling right now. When I first talked to my mom about me having depression (not having fun no matter what I do for over half a year, not getting out of bed in the morning, small things like doing the dishes seemed like a whole mountain of work, really anxious about work and getting really unwell just thinking about goimg etc.) she brushed it off as "everyone has those kind of days". The only thing I can tell you is to a) talk to your normal doc about it. He should have some basic knowledge about it and if he thinks there is something he can send you to a professional or b) try again and show her how urgent it is. I tried the second one and for me it worked. Not really as well as I liked it but it kinda did. Try to tell her exactly how you feel and why you think its important to see a professional. If you need to exaggerate a bit when talking to her but be 100% honest with the doctor. I know its hard talking about it again after beeing shut down once but I know you can do it. Maybe tell her how the schools isnt really trained for stuff like that and that you feel like youre not getting the treatment you need from them. I know you can do it and I believe in you! I wish you well and good luck talking to them!

Growing up my parents always told me Im lazy, selfish and always let them spoil me. Of course I believed that after years of hearing that and I was convinced its true until a little bit ago. My bf came over and we dont see each other too often. He got a bit sick while staying here so I did everything I could to help him get better. Let him sleep on the bed while im on the sofa so I dont wake him up in the morning when I had to leave, cook him chicken soup and anything else he likes, bring him anything he asks for. That already surprised me after realizing what I did. After all Im still a lazy and selfish girl in my head. But I also did this all while running a fever. I never thought I would be able to do something like that, not only because I believed what my parents said was true but also because Im usually pretty plaintive and my depression makes things only worse. Im really proud of myself. It isnt much but Im glad finally can accept that my parents werent right and prove to myself that Im not just a bad person.

When I was younger my mother took me to a shaman. I dont know why she brought me there but it was probably because I had some problems or whatever and since she went there regularly with my disabled brother she took me there too. She did her stuff and felt that a presence or something like that stuck to me and asked if someone died recently in our family or maybe someone else who was close. Noone did the only person that died was my great grandma about 6 or 7 years ago. She asked her name and continued. She then asked for the name a couple of times again until she said shes always getting a weird name from that presence and thats why shes asking over and over again. My great grandmas name was Elizabeth. She told my mom the weird name she always got and my mom was shocked. It was a stupid nickname she was called when she was young that has nothing to do with her actual name so theres actually no way she could have guessed that right without knowing. I didnt know that name because that was from before my time but the look on my moms face said it all. She said shes still stuck with me because shes worried because I blame myself. I really did but never told anyone about it. I missed the last time I could see her because I rather played video games than going meet her. She died the same night and I blamed myself since then. I dont know how she did it but something had to be going on Im 100% sure of it.

When do you want kids? Can you afford a child and give it the life it deserves? Maybe talk about this with your SO when youre both calm and have plenty of time. Maybe shes in a hurry to have kids because she thinks youll drag it out for a long time and thats what causes her to be uneasy. I dont know when youre ready but lets just say you tell her you want to settle into your job and save some money first and you would rather wait like 3 years or so maybe it calms her down. From my perspective having kids early like in your 20s is not bad because I always think when your child is 10ish or so you can still play with them outside because youre still young too and can move around freely compared to when youre in your 30s when you have your first child. Youll then be in your 40s and maybe you already have some smaller health issues that limit your ability to roam around with it like problems with your back and so on. But that does not mean its ok for her doing this. Youre still really young and have time so Id talk to her about it, saying you need a bit more time and if you already know, tell her when that might be so she can calm down. Do you know why shes in a hurry? Maybe some health conditions run in her family she never told you about which make her feel the need to have kids right here and now. If you cant talk to her about it properly maybe try a couple therapist or something like that.

When I was 18 I had a pretty similar experience. I know its hard but you have to stay strong. I think its better for you to not be with him anymore. It seems like he didnt value the relationship as much as you did. I remember beeing all alone too since his friends became mine and after we broke up I had noone left in my life since they all "sided" with him since they were friends for a long time while I only knew them for about 2 years. Do you have any hobbies you can focus on to distract yourself or a way you can get to know new people? For me I focused on gaming with strangers online of which some became friends and I also used food as comfort which helped at the moment. If you can stay away from alcohol. It wont do you any good and might just make things worse. Its going to be a hard time but youll get through it, I just know you can. As for your period, I also have terrible pain and got really strong painkillers years ago until my gynecologist told me I could just take birthcontrol without the breaks so I dont have my period anymore which also helped me a lot at that time and also in my life in general. I might not give the best advice but since Ive been through something very similar maybe I can help just a bit.

I started my drivers licence when I was 16. My parents urged me to do it since I had no job over the summer and they said they would like a little help with shopping ect. since my brother is disabled. I live in austria so I had to drive 3k km to get the drivers licence with 17 and to be honest Im really glad I had to. Starting it I was really anxious as well and my hands got so sweaty I had a hard time to get a grip on the steering wheel. I dont know about germany but cant you get a "L Tafel" where you can drive with your parents while doing your licence? It took me quite some time to get used to it but I think half way through it got better. Maybe you could ask your dad if you could practice somewhere quiet where hardly anyone drives? I think hell understand since just starting to drive can be quite scary especially if you suffer from anxiety. I didnt want to do it in the first place but now Im glad I did. Sure you can get almost anywhere with public transport but once you have it, you can still use it or sometimes take the care if its late which Im really happy about. If you want you can message me. I know how hard it is since I suffer from anxiety and depression aswell. Hope things turn out well for you. Good luck.

What helped me with that although it seemed really stupid is before my first driving lesson my teacher had to make a call. He told me to go through them 1 to 5 and back until he finished. At first in my head I was like "Thats stupid, I know where it is, why should I do that" but it helped me get a better feeling for it. Sure, its something else while driving but maybe theres a street in the fields or something where you can practice. I cant really explain it to you since now it all feels natural but youll get there if you want. I dont know about germany but here if you only drive with automatic youre only allowed to drive automatic in the future. To be honest automatic is kinda scary to me since it drives off more or less on its own. But I hope it works for you! Good luck.

I always self harmed on my thigh out if fear people would see it. I was never a fan of shorts so noone would see them anyway. If I had to change with other people I covered them with a huge bandaid since they were all really close together and a big ome was enough to cover them. I do have one rather big scar on my arm though. When it was fresh I just wore a bandaid for months. People probably noticed something was going on but noone ever talked about it to me and I never heared anyone talking about it. You could either try switching places you self harm or just get used to long sleeves if you really dont want anyone to see them. I know someone who has lots of scars on their arm and I never heared someone talking about it but I dont know if they really never did or I just didnt hear it. I think people never really cared that much what I was doing so they never brought it up or really didnt realize what was going on. People will probably look at it in the beginning though. At least thats my experience.

You dont need a "reason" to feel this way. Anyone can feel like that and anyone can be depressed. Sometimes it just feels normal to you because youre used to it but the truth is you have it rough. I always thought my life is normal and I shouldnt be depressed. Shouldnt be suicidal because people have it worse. But that doesnt matter. Everyone can feel that way. And just because your upbringing feels normal to you doesnt mean that it was not hard or tragicor whatever. If youre feeling this way you can and should seek help. You dont need to explain them how it came to you feeling this way. Thats the therapists job. All that matters is that you feel this way and that your feelings are valid. No matter your circumstances. Mental illnesses are just like the flu or a cold. Everyone can get it. Some tend to get it more frequently than others but in the end it could hit everyone.

I had one. It was just a huge log cemented into the ground with a little wooden house ontop and my dad insisted on a rope ladder which made it a huge pain in the ass to get up since it was under the door and you needed to do some kind of acrobatics to get in. I always hated heights so it was a horror tripto get in but when we were in it was lots of fun. Although it was rather small. We could get stuff in through one of the windows since you could reach up there from a climbing thing if you were tall enough so sometimes we eveb had dinner up there. Once slept i there with friends and it was fucking cold although it was summer. TL;DR: It is nice but kinda overrated. Especially if you have a rope ladder and are afraid of heights.

Its fine. I know how it feels so its important to me to help people who are going through the same thing. It might take some time to really take it in and accept it 100%. Therapy helped me a lot with coming to terms that my feelings are valid too and that im not egoistic just for looking after me and that its normal to have bad days. Ive also came to accept those bad days since they helped me appreciate the good days even more. After all we cant have good days without the bad ones. And one day youll be looking back realizing that youve managed all that though shit and became a really strong person without knowing it. Knowing you fought and didnt just take the easy way. Its something you can be and should be proud of. If you ever need someone to talk to feel free to message me. I might not respond immediatly but Ill try my best to answer as soon as possible (job, life, depression, ect.)

Not a kid but as a teen I had no electricity for a while. My room had a seperate electricity switch or however you call them so my dad just turned it off. To make things clear: he raoed you and you owe him nothing. You dont have to give birth to this child and you shouldnt feel bad if you want to abort it. Butt if you do feel bad think about it this way: how will the child feel? A rapist as a father who doesnt seem mentally stable and a mother who maybe cant bring herself to love it due to what happened. I think abortion would be the best option although its 100% up to you what you want to do. You should look into getting therapy. You went through a lot and you should probably work on it so you can at least try and leave things behind. I was sexually harrassed when I was younger and only got therapy like 15 years later and if I knew how much it helps I woukd have tried it earlier. It can be hard on you, probably will be at times, but overall I can say it helps a ton. Last but not least: look after yourself and try to keep the people who pressure you or are mean to you out of your life. You did nothing wrong and you shouldnt feel bad. Those people dont know what happened and probably dont really think about what they are saying and how it feels for you. Dont feel bad to just cut them out of your life. It might be hard and maybe youll feel bad but you shouldnt. You have every right to do so. After all you went through something horrible and you have to live with it, not them. Learning how to look after yourself can be quitr the journey but its really important, especially if youre in a situation like you are.
